H0.text: Extinct is the condition a species may reach when the environment changes more quickly than the species can adapt.

H1.text: Dominant is what a species may become when the environment changes more quickly than the species can adapt.

H2.text: Diverse is what a species may become when the environment changes more quickly than the species can adapt.

H3.text: Overpopulated species may result when the environment changes more quickly than a species can adapt.

A4.text: Most simply, any species that cannot survive and reproduce in its environment and cannot move to a new environment where it can do so, dies out and becomes extinct.

A5.text: If adaptation increasing population fitness is slower than environmental degradation plus the accumulation of slightly deleterious mutations, then a population will go extinct.
